title: The Missing Project
intro:
You arrive at school early on Wednesday morning to check on your science fair project one last time before the judging begins. The hallway is quiet, with only a few teachers preparing their classrooms. You walk toward the display tables set up in the main corridor where all the projects are arranged.

As you approach your assigned spot, you notice something strange. Your volcano model is there, but the data chart you spent weeks creating is missing. The colorful poster showing your experiment results was taped right next to the volcano yesterday afternoon. Now there's just an empty space on the table.

checkpoints.prompt:
You look around and see Jamal setting up his weather station project two tables away. At the far end of the hall, Ms. Rodriguez is hanging streamers for the fair. Near the gym entrance, you spot Zara organizing papers at a table covered with what looks like multiple project displays.

Your chart could be anywhere, and the judging starts in less than two hours.

choices.text: Walk directly to Zara and ask if she's seen your missing chart
Approach Jamal and mention that your poster is missing
Search around your own table area first

checkpoints.prompt:
After your initial search, you notice the janitor's cart parked near the main office. Mr. Chen, the night custodian, is emptying trash bins and organizing cleaning supplies. You also see that the lost and found box outside the principal's office has several papers sticking out of the top.

The morning announcement crackles over the intercom, reminding everyone that science fair judging begins at 9:30 AM.

choices.text: Ask Mr. Chen if he moved any papers while cleaning last night
Check the lost and found box for your chart

checkpoints.prompt:
Students begin arriving for the day, filling the hallways with chatter and locker slams. You overhear Keisha telling her friend that she saw some papers scattered near the trophy case yesterday after school. The art room door opens, and Mrs. Park steps out carrying a stack of colorful posters.

The clock on the wall shows 8:45 AM. You have forty-five minutes before the judges arrive.

choices.text: Head to the trophy case to look for scattered papers
Ask Mrs. Park about the posters she's carrying
Return to your project table and recreate the chart from memory

ending: You take action with your decision, moving through the busy hallway as more students arrive. The science fair setup continues around you, with teachers making final adjustments to displays and students checking their projects. The judges will arrive soon, and whatever happens next will unfold as the morning progresses.
